There are several things you can do to keep your hair looking healthy:

1. Eat a balanced diet: Eating the right foods can help provide all the essential nutrients required for maintaining healthy hair, including protein, vitamins, and minerals.

2. Shampoo properly: Avoid overwashing your hair as excessive shampooing may cause dryness and strip the scalp of its natural oils. Choose a sulfate-free mild shampoo suitable for your hair type.

3. Condition your hair: Applying conditioner after washing helps replenish moisture in the strands and combats frizz.

4. Limit heat styling tools: Using blow dryers, flat irons or any other such tools frequently may damage hair cuticles leading to breakage, therefore it's always better to air-dry whenever possible.

5. Get regular trims: Trim off split ends every 6-8 weeks to maintain healthier-looking strands.

6. Protect from sun exposure: Excessive sun exposure weakens keratin bonds within the strand structure causing brittleness & color fade; so use cover-ups like hats or protective leave-in conditioners during summers when outdoors for long stretches of time!
